tasks.task: Preparation for Riding and Looking after Horses
subtasks: Showing up at the appointed time
Traveling to the location (Marietta Farms)
Removing outer clothing (coat and shoes)
Putting on riding gloves
Mounting the horse (possibly part of looking after the horse)
Basic horse care and handling (includes leading the horse if necessary)
Assisting with checking crops for watering needs
Assisting with applying fertilizer on the field
Observing the crop growth, health, and condition
Removing old mower blades
Ensuring the new blades are properly attached
Testing the mower to ensure it functions correctly
Loading the manure spreader onto the truck
Distributing manure evenly on the fields
Cleaning up the implement after use
Checking the readiness of produce for pickup
Ensuring the products meet quality standards
Sweeping greenhouse floors
Tearing off residues (possibly of mulch or debris)
Gathering wheel ruts from the field
Checking tires for damage and proper air pressure
Tare the scales to account for packaging materials
Weighing individual boxes of product
Hand-packing produce into boxes
Ensuring correct labeling and documentation
Piling up the mulch in the desired configuration
Ensuring stable stacking for safety
Monitoring camera coverage to ensure security
Checking gates for safety and functionality
Collecting water samples from the sedimentation tank
Monitoring the clarity and quality of the water
Checking for potential issues on crops (e.g., pests, diseases)
Inspecting equipment for any needed maintenance
Working with checks and cash handling for payments
Relaying financial information or possibly cashing checks
Gathering samples from the field for testing
Analyzing the results for appropriate fertilizer application
Preparing application equipment (e.g., sprayer)
Ensuring safety measures are followed during application
Monitoring the spread and effects of the pesticide
Recycling or disposing of excess materials properly
Assisting customers at the pick-your-own area
Ensuring produce is ripe and meets quality standards
Helping patrons fill their baskets or bags
Potentially data entry, perhaps of crop information or sales
Assisting customers with information or questions at the Agri-Food pickup
Engaging with clients about farm services or products
Assisting with moving the manure spreader or other vehicles
Driving the truck to transport materials (e.g., manure spreader)
Maneuvering into position for spreading or other tasks
Loading the spreader onto the truck bed
Unloading materials like mulch or feed
Ensuring the load is secure (tarping, if needed)
Verifying proper water flow to the fields
Checking for clogs or blockages
Regularly checking safety equipment (helmets, gloves, etc.) for all operations
Ensuring tools are returned to their proper places after use
Lubricating equipment as needed (e.g., manure spreader)
Maintaining logs or records of tasks performed
Updating schedules or checklists
Attending meetings to discuss farm operations
Identifying and addressing issues with machinery (e.g., mower stopping short)
Fixing or building simple structures (e.g., shed, gate) as needed
Using a chain saw to trim trees, cut mulch, etc.
Communicating instructions between farm staff or to customers
Cutting and bundling bales
Stacking them properly for storage or sale
Verifying practices comply with environmental guidelines
Observing the condition of the grass or pasture
Ensuring livestock are grazing appropriately
Possibly moving fence lines or gates
Gathering eggs from laying hens
Ensuring proper loading into transport vehicle
Maintaining animal safety during transit
Preparing the greenhouse for planting or inspections
Inspecting structural integrity (i.e., checking for breaks or damage)
Spreading compost or other organic matter
Mixing with existing soil for better fertility
Ensuring bins are adequately filled and managed
Possibly mixing feed as needed (e.g., combining grass and hay)
Organizing the movement of equipment between fields
Scheduling tasks to maximize efficiency
Confirming that safety equipment and procedures are in place
Checking first aid supplies
Using walkie-talkies or other means to communicate with other staff

tasks.task: Inspecting Equipment for Imaging or Calibration
subtasks: Ensuring that tools or equipment like irrigation systems are properly calibrated
Checking plant health and progress
Ensuring adequate ventilation and light
Removing debris from the field
Ensuring the area is safe for next planting
Ensuring the farm grounds are clean and welcoming
Possibly monitoring visitor entry and exit points
Distributing mulch evenly across planting areas
Ensuring proper coverage and placement
Observing weather forecasts for planning purposes
Adjusting farm activities based on weather predictions
Having briefings on day-to-day tasks and to-do lists
Handing over orders of agricultural products to customers
Ensuring accurate billing or payment collection

tasks.task: Assisting with the Setup and Teardown of Events
subtasks: Putting up signage or decorations for events
Cleaning up after events (e.g., removing garbage, setting up for next day)
Shredding cornstalks or other biomass material
Observing other staff members' work to ensure safety and efficiency
Handling cash transactions for produce purchases
Updating inventory records based on sales
Checking for proper functioning of irrigation systems
Ensuring water levels in reservoirs or tanks
Redirecting or managing floodwaters to prevent damage
Constructing barriers or barriers as needed
Wiping down and cleaning implements after use
Taking samples to assess soil health
Using test kits or sending to laboratory
Ensuring that farm animals have adequate feed
Possibly mixing different types of feed
Using tools to unclog sprayers or other machinery
Possibly mapping out fields for efficiency or applying inputs precisely
Parking and aligning vehicles for easy access
Updating spreadsheets or logs for financial or operational purposes
Ensuring hay is adequately sheltered from the elements
Planting or maintaining trees that provide shade or windbreak

tasks.task: Leading a Vehicle onto a Scale
subtasks: Safely moving the manure spreader or trailer onto the scale for tare
Loading and distributing fertilizer across fields
Using rakes, shovels, hoes, etc., depending on the task
Applying mulch to protect soil or enhance growth
Gathering mulch from the supply area
Potentially balancing multiple roles or responsibilities during the day
